= ಇಡ್ಡಲಿ.
a pudding made of rice flour, black gram and cooked in steam, a very common food in the Southern India.
= ಇಡ್ಡಲಿ.
a kind of sour pudding made of rice flour, black gram, cumin seed, ginger, salt, pepper etc. and baked in steam.
= ಇಡ್ಡಲಿ.
something that impedes; an obstacle; an impediment; a hindrance.
= ಇಡ್ಡಲಿ.
an uncontrolled ox or bull; an ox or bull that is let lose.
a secret looking through a small opening or from a place of hiding; a peeping.
= ಇಣಿಕು.
a bushy-tailed rodent of the family Sciuridae, with grey fur living chiefly in trees; squirrel.
a device of wood, iron, etc. for going up or down by, often portable and consisting of two long uprights, connected by rungs or cross-pieces, which form steps; a ladder.
a rounded, protruding lump, as the fleshy mass on the back of a camel, bull, etc; a hump.
to look through a small opening or from a place of hiding; to peer slyly or secretly; to peep.
ಇಣಿಕಿಕ್ಕು iṇikikku = ಇಣಿಕು; ಇಣಿಕಿಣಿಕು iṇkiṇiku = (dupl. of) ಇಣಿಕು; ಇಣಿಕಿನೋಡು iṇkinōḍu = ಇಣಿಕು.
a hole to peep through; a peep-hole; an eye-hole.
(said of animals like ox, camel etc.) to have a hump ( on the back).
= ಇಣಿಕು.
= ಇಣಿಕಿಕ್ಕು.
= ಇಣಿಕಿಣಿಕು.
